intro: Stomatochaeta colveei, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Stomatochaeta colveei is a member of the Urticaceae family, which includes other plants with similar stinging hairs.
